name: abridgment
content:
abridgment noun
(SHORTER VERSION)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] a book, play, or piece of writing that has been made shorter by removing some details or less important information: The books are abridgments of well-known classics. In 1676 Bauthumley published an abridgement of Foxe's Book of Martyrs.
[ U ] the act of making a book, play, or piece of writing shorter by removing some details or information: Drastic abridgment makes this story even more difficult to understand. This version of the play is marred only by some awkward abridgement.
More examplesFewer examplesI didn't want my work to be merely an abridgment of the hearings.The document is an English abridgment of the Japanese original. There seems to be a current enthusiasm for extreme abridgement.
